questions.question: What is supervised machine learning?
options: A. A type of learning where the model learns from labeled data.
B. A type of learning where the model learns from unlabeled data.
C. A type of learning where the model learns from reinforcement.
D. A type of learning where the model learns from semi-labeled data.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of supervised learning algorithm?
options: A. K-Means clustering
B. Decision tree
C. K-Nearest Neighbors
D. Apriori algorithm

questions.question: What is the primary goal of supervised learning?
options: A. To minimize error on the training data.
B. To maximize accuracy on the test data.
C. To generalize well on unseen data.
D. To memorize the training data.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks is NOT typically performed in supervised learning?
options: A. Classification
B. Clustering
C. Regression
D. Anomaly detection

questions.question: What is the process of supervised learning?
options: A. Feature engineering, model selection, training, evaluation
B. Data collection, feature selection, training, deployment
C. Data preprocessing, model training, testing, deployment
D. Feature extraction, model validation, testing, deployment
